metadata.title: CVE-2018-12127 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
Microarchitectural Load Port Data Sampling (MLPDS): Load ports on somemicroprocessors utilizing speculative execution may allow an authenticateduser to potentially enable information disclosure via a side channel withlocal access. A list of impacted products can be found here:https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/corporate-information/SA00233-microcode-update-guidance_05132019.pdf

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20190514.0ubuntu1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25

No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.20190514.0ubuntu1').

qemu package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4').
libvirt package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1ubuntu4').
linux-raspi package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.5').
linux-ibm package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-24.24').
